articles.title: While Beijing calls citizens back to work, there are few signs of a return to normal - The Globe and Mail
articles.description: A trip through rural and industrial areas of Chongqing indicates the opposite, suggesting the massive disruptions to a lynchpin of global manufacturing and trade are unlikely to be resolved soon
articles.content:
Am I scared? Who isnt? said Zhang Zhengguo, 81, here working a vegetable plot in the Fengdu Industrial Zone on Feb. 8 and wearing a mask amid fears of contagion from the Wuhan coronavirus.
Nathan VanderKlippe/The Globe and Mail
